abstract: Even as Greece pledged anew on Wednesday to rein in its runaway budget deficit, briefly easing the anxiety over its perilous finances, traders on both sides of the Atlantic weighed the risks — and potential rewards — posed by the groaning debts of other European governments.
snippet: Even as Greece pledged anew on Wednesday to rein in its runaway budget deficit, briefly easing the anxiety over its perilous finances, traders on both sides of the Atlantic weighed the risks — and potential rewards — posed by the groaning debts of...
lead_paragraph: Is Spain the next Greece? Or Italy? Or Portugal?

abstract: Greece’s debt agency announced Thursday that it would issue 8 billion euros in five-year bonds a day after its government announced new austerity measures worth 4.8 billion euros to battle its rampant deficit.
snippet: Greece’s debt agency announced Thursday that it would issue 8 billion euros in five-year bonds a day after its government announced new austerity measures worth 4.8 billion euros to battle its rampant deficit.
lead_paragraph: Greece’s debt agency announced Thursday that it would issue 8 billion euros in bonds with a coupon of 6.1 percent to mature in 2015, a day after its government announced new austerity measures worth 4.8 billion euros to battle its rampant deficit.

headline.main: Greece Embarks on New Debt Issues

abstract: Both the European Central Bank and the Bank of England remained concerned about the strength of the economic recovery.
snippet: Both the European Central Bank and the Bank of England remained concerned about the strength of the economic recovery.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — The European Central Bank and the Bank of England left their benchmark interest rates unchanged at record lows on Thursday, as both worried about the strength of the economic recovery.

headline.main: Interest Rates Held Steady in Britain and Euro-Zone
headline.print_headline: Uncertain of Recovery, Europe and Britain Keep Interest Rates Unchanged

byline.original: By Jack Ewing and Julia Werdigier

abstract: The Treasury Department said on Thursday that it has raised more than $1.5 billion from the sale of warrants it held from its bailout of Bank of America, the most it has raised in selling off an investment in an American bank gained as part of its financial rescue plan.
snippet: The Treasury Department said on Thursday that it has raised more than $1.5 billion from the sale of warrants it held from its bailout of Bank of America, the most it has raised in selling off an investment in an American bank gained as part of its...
lead_paragraph: 10:44 a.m. | Updated The Treasury Department said on Thursday that it had raised more than $1.5 billion from the sale of warrants it held from its bailout of Bank of America, the most it has raised in selling off an investment in an American bank gained as part of its financial rescue plan.

headline.main: U.S. Reaps $1.5 Billion From Sale of BofA Warrants
